page.title: 08MOTTRAM VILLAGE FETE
page.content: Every year, in July, Mottram Village Hall Committee hold a fete. Money raised goes to help run the Village Hall. In 1985 the Fete raised about Â£550. At the Fete there are side-shows such as Tombola, knocking over cans, throwing wet sponges at people in stocks etc.Stalls selling hot dogs, cakes, ice cream and minerals, sports clothes and teas are spread around the field and hall. At the 1985 Fete Bollington Brass Band provided the music. Mottram St. Andrew Primary School put on a display of country dancing. There was a Fancy Dress Competition, various races for children and a Sack Throwing Competition. The day was fine and warm. by Ross Anderson and Ian Finlow
